Message.Title: Intel And Advanced Micro Devices: The 1-2 Punch To Knock Out Nvidia
Message.Msg: Another Intel's going to rule the world article. Enclosed is the last paragraph... "I see a high probability of Nvidia experiencing a decline in earnings and ultimately a share price below $10 by March or April of 2014. It is my opinion that it is time to take profits from any positions in this company from the recent run up of the share price and move those profits to another position."

Topic.Title: Intel And Advanced Micro Devices: The 1-2 Punch To Knock Out Nvidia

Message.Msg: So Intel engineers say the Iris Pro, which has not shipped and was tested in their labs, is as good as the GT 650M, a year old gpu that was just replaced with the GT 750M. I will believe this load of garbage when an independant review is done without cherry picked games.

Topic.Title: Intel And Advanced Micro Devices: The 1-2 Punch To Knock Out Nvidia

Message.Msg: Intel always compared its next-gen, not-yet-released product with NVIDIA's last-gen offerings. So we are two generations in between.....lol

Topic.Title: Intel And Advanced Micro Devices: The 1-2 Punch To Knock Out Nvidia

Message.Msg: Hot air can lift hot air balloons, but that's about it. Don't give them more power than they have.

Message.Title: 40% cash
Message.Msg: NVDA is selling at a valuation that is only slightly more than twice its cash position. That's amazing for a profitable company. And if you believe their growth rate of 12% then it would only take about 7 years for them to be all cash at this stock price. You can buy private companies with that kind of return but of course are also ill-liquid. This is a NO BRAINER at this level.

Topic.Title: Seems like big $$$ flowed into NVDA today...

Message.Msg: msians, you were right about big $$$ coming into the stock today. Per WSJ, NVDA has been on "Buy on Weakness" list throughout the day. Overall up volume/down volume: 6.9:1 (7 shares initiated as BUY vs 1 share initiated as SELL) Institutional block up-volume: 54.5 million; NO DOWN-VOLUME. ALL BUYS for big boyz. onlineDOTwsjDOTcom/mdc/public/page/2_3022-mfgppl-moneyflow.html I believe you can access this site without a subscription. When you do, look at far right columns for institutional activities.

Message.Title: Full disclosure by Tiernan Ray, Barron's principal tech columnist
Message.Msg: He wrote in an article published today: blogsDOTbarronsDOTcom/techtraderdaily/2013/05/31/full-disclosure-i-trade-nothing-4/ "I adhere to the Dow Jones rule of conduct, which is that I do not write about anything in which I have a financial interest. I got rid of any stock holdings when I joined Dow Jones in 2005, and have never returned to investing in any securities in the time since." Quite admirable. I wonder if our resident SA bloggers can say the same thing? - Or even consider that there could be an issue of conflict of interest? Different ethical and moral standards, for sure.
